intro: Stoebe leiocarpa, commonly known as smooth blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Stoebe leiocarpa is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
